flawed_nl_solution:
He has 30*6=<<30*6=180>>180 students
So he needs to buy 180*10=<<180*10=8100>>8100 index cards
That means he needs to buy 8100/50=<<8100/50=162>>162 packs of index cards
So he spends 162*3=$<<162*3=486>>486
#### 486

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1800, not 8100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
